titleStmt.title: J.J. Johnson v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: J.J. Johnson v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss
In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Wash- ington Territory, holding terms at Olympia, for the Counties of Thurston, Lewis, Mason and Chehalis.
The United States Plaintiff vs. J.J. Johnson Defendant

And now the said J.J. Johnson is brought to the bar of the court here and being asked if he have any legal cause to show why judg- ment should not be pronounced against says nothing as he before has said wherefore allowed singular the premises being seen and by the Judge of the Court here fully understand, it is considered by the Court that the said J.J. Johnson pay a fine of three hundred dollars and the costs of this action and that he be imprisoned for the term of three months and that he be further imprisoned till said fine and costs are paid not to exceed three months and it appearing to the Court that there is no penitentiary or other prison of the United States in this Ter- ritory ready for the reception of pris- oners it is ordered that the said J.J. Johnson as imprisoned in the county jail of Thurston County, till the further order of the Court. Costs $7.42 December 14 1874
I, J.H. Houghton Clerk of said Court do hereby certify that the foregoing is a true copy from the of the Court.
In Witness whereof I hereto set my hand and the seal of said Court this 19th day of December A.D. 1874.
